thread.title: National Security Adviser: Iran 'Officially On Notice' After Missile Test
thread.title_full: National Security Adviser: Iran 'Officially On Notice' After Missile Test

title: National Security Adviser: Iran 'Officially On Notice' After Missile Test

organizations.name: philly anchor makes another inappropriate comment trump cancels signing of cybersecurity executive order

text:
The White House has officially put Iran “on notice” following reports the country has tested several ballistic missiles since reaching an agreement with the Obama administration, according to President Trump’s national security adviser.
“As of today we are officially putting Iran on notice,” Mike Flynn told reporters Wednesday during a daily White House briefing.
Flynn argued that the Obama administration had “emboldened” Iran by failing “to respond adequately” to Iran’s previous acts of aggressive behavior.
  New York Times Proves Trump’s Order Not A ‘Ban On Muslims’ Bush’s Daughter Sends Message About Trump’s Immigration Ban: ‘This Is Not The America I Know’ Evangelical Leader Picked To Lead Trump’s College Reform Panel “The Obama administration failed to respond adequately to Tehran’s malign actions — including weapons transfers, support for terrorism, and other violations of international norms,” Flynn said. “The Trump administration condemns such actions by Iran that undermine security, prosperity, and stability throughout and beyond the Middle East and … place American lives at risk.”

The Trump administration’s statement came after the Iranian government conducted a missile test Monday, the same day an Iranian-backed group in Yemen, known as Houthi rebels, attacked a Saudi naval vessel earlier this week. Two Saudi sailors were killed and three were wounded in the attack.
 
Two Defense Department officials told Fox News the attack may have been meant for an American warship, or was a practice run for a similar attack against an American warship.
“President Trump has severely criticized the various agreements reached between Iran and the Obama Administration, as well as the United Nations, as being weak and ineffective,” Flynn said. “Instead of being thankful to the United States for these agreements, Iran is now feeling emboldened.”
Flynn refrained from elaborating on whether the U.S. would take action beyond a verbal warning.
Senior administration officials said Wednesday they are still in the early stages of determining what action the U.S. should take in response to Iran’s highly provocative behavior.
  Trump Honors Scalia’s Widow As He Nominates Scalia’s Successor After Suspension For Attacking Conway, Philly Anchor Makes Another Inappropriate Comment Trump Cancels Signing Of Cybersecurity Executive Order “We are considering a whole range of options. We’re in a deliberative process,” one official said.
The National Iranian American Council repudiated Flynn’s threat.
“Michael Flynn’s statement on Iran today was reckless,” said Trita Parsi of the NIAC in a statement . “While Flynn’s remarks could be construed as simply bluster, they will beget an Iranian response which in turn will beget further threats by the U.S. At some point, this escalatory cycle that started with bluster may end in war.”
What do you think?
